div.head: Glossary

list.head: Rare Book Terminology
list.label: Aldine
list.item: Venetian printer Aldus Manutius became famous for publishing a series of pocket editions of the Greek and Latin classics. Aldus Manutius's dolphin and anchor printing device was later used by William Pickering for his "Aldine Classics" series of English literature.
list.label: boards
list.item: The hard covers of a book. Both the boards themselves and their covering can be made from a variety of materials. "Original boards" refers to those boards in which a book was first bound for distribution; they are highly prized by some collectors.
list.label: broken
list.item: A binding that has been forced or strained, causing the book to lose its shape, or a binding that has broken completely into pieces.
list.label: buckram
list.item: A durable bookbinding cloth, consisting of woven linen or cotton threads coated or filled with stablizing materials.
list.label: calf
list.item: Leather made from calf hide, used in bookbinding.
list.label: cancelled
list.item: Removed from a book, usually due to a printing error. The original leaf is called the "cancelland", while the replacement leaf is called the "cancel".
list.label: édition de luxe
list.item: A book meant to be admired for its luxurious qualities, such as being printed on special paper.
list.label: ex libris
list.item: Literally "from the library of"; a bookplate
list.label: extra
list.item: Elegantly bound, usually with gilt edges and decorations.
list.label: facsimile
list.item: A copy of a leaf or a book, meant to imitate the original as closely as possible.
list.label: first edition
list.item: The first appearance of a work in print
list.label: fly-leaf
list.item: The endpaper, usually blank, that is not glued to the inside front cover of a book
list.label: frontispiece
list.item: An illustration that faces the title page of a book
list.label: gauffered
list.item: Gilt and decorated with impressed designs
list.label: gilt
list.item: Cut smooth and covered in a thin layer of gold
list.label: half
list.item: A binding in which the spine and outer corners are made of leather or vellum, while the rest of the binding is made out of paper or cloth
list.label: headline
list.item: A line of type at the top of a page, above the main text
list.label: imperial
list.item: Made with large and/or fine paper for an "imperial paper copy;" or made with imperial-sized paper
list.label: India proof
list.item: A proof (usually of an engraving) printed on thin, soft paper
list.label: Japanese vellum
list.item: A stiff, smooth hand-made paper used primarily for éditions de luxe
list.label: joint
list.item: The area on the exterior of a book where the spine meets the covers
list.label: levant morocco
list.item: An elegant, highly polished morocco leather used in bookbinding
list.label: loose
list.item: A book that has been damaged/used to the point where the pages are not securely fastened to the binding
list.label: morocco
list.item: Leather made from goatskin, often dyed bright colors
list.label: octavo/8vo
list.item: A book format made from sheets of paper that have been folded three times
list.label: plates
list.item: Full-page illustrations, printed separately from the text
list.label: presentation copy
list.item: A book given as a gift by the author
list.label: roan
list.item: Thin skeepskin used as a cheaper alternative to morocco
list.label: royal
list.item: Made with large and/or fine paper for a "royal paper copy"; or made with royal-sized paper
list.label: rules
list.item: Lines marking the borders or margins of a page
list.label: russia
list.item: Cowhide leather that has been treated with birch oil, giving it a characteristic look and smell
list.label: tooling
list.item: Decorative impressions made by hand with metal tools
list.label: tree-calf
list.item: A calf hide binding that has been stained with a pattern that resembles wood grain
list.label: uncut
list.item: Edges of a book that have not been trimmed or cut down
list.label: vellum
list.item: Untanned calfskin which has been scraped, stretched, and dried; can be used in bookbinding or as a writing support
list.label: wanting
list.item: missing, not included
list.label: woodcut
list.item: A printed illustration made from a carved wood block
list.label: worming
list.item: Holes made by book-worms in the paper, boards, and/or leather binding of a book

div.p: For the development of this glossary, we are indebted to the following: ABAA Glossary Carter, John: ABC for Book Collectors (Oak Knoll Press, 2016) Roberts, Matt and Don Etherington: Bookbinding and the Conservation of Books (Library of Congress, 1982)

bibl.title: Works, edited, with Notes, by R. H. Shepherd

bibl.note: The first two entires in this lot refer to the Hotten (volume 1) and Chatto and Windus (vols. 2-4) edition of Shelley's works, which is titled The Poetical Works of Percy Bysshe Shelley. Volumes were referred to as series, so volume one has “First Series” on the title page, volume two “Second Series,” and so on. Also, the “Second Series” does not include a date on the title page, which conforms to the catalog’s “n.d.” description. The 1875 date would only apply to series/volume 4, but we have included links to all four volumes. Given Swinburne’s relationship with Hotten and Chatto and Windus, not to mention his love of Shelley, it is very likely that Swinburne owned the whole set.
